info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 06 at 10:59PM MST until January 09 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations 1 to 3 inches are possible for most with 4 to 6 inches across Raton Pass and Capulin. North winds could gust as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Far Northeast Highlands, Harding County, Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass, and Union County. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-25, US 64/87, and Hwy 56. Very strong winds could cause periods of whiteout conditions, dangerous crosswinds across east to west oriented highways, and snow drifts over 1 foot in depth. Additionally, extensive damage to trees and power lines is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall and strongest winds are expected during the day Monday. Areas of blowing snow are still possible Monday night after the snowfall ends.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
